text: ratatouille is a classic French dish
it's traditionally a vegetable stew of
eggplant tomatoes lots of vegetables you
may have seen this served on pasta or
just as a simple side dish but I love to
add an egg to it which makes it a little
bit more hearty adds a nice healthy
protein so let's get started
I'm starting with 1 large eggplant cut
it into three-quarter inch pieces they
don't have to be absolutely perfect just
look for a nice even size ok so season
this very generously I'm shooting for
about a tablespoon of salt so the salt
is going to help draw out any of the
bitter compounds also it'll tenderize it
flavor it through and through so I'll
let this hang out for about half an hour
on the counter so my eggplant has salted
for 30 minutes i rinsed it and patted it
dry while that was salting I got started
on the rest of the recipes I'm going to
finish up with cutting up another tomato
this is 2 tomatoes total just core out
the stem end and slice this into about
three-quarter inch chunks so the
tomatoes will get tossed in with those
raw it's almost like a vinaigrette add
to that two tablespoons of fresh thyme
smells great
one tablespoon chopped oregano this is
all the flavors of summer one of my
favorite favorite dishes and then I'm
going to toss this with two tablespoons
of olive oil
that's good season with salt give it a
quick stir so this will just marinate
and become even more juicy and delicious
and flavorful
while my vegetables are roasting now
let's get started on the roasted section
we have the eggplant that we already
salted and rinsed and patted dry I'm
going to add this to one onion already
sliced up thinly four cloves of garlics
lots of flavor 2 tablespoons of olive
oil
season with salt cracked pepper give it
a toss let's spread this out on rimmed
baking sheet when we're roasting super
important to not overload each baking
sheet what will end up happening is the
vegetables will steam before they
caramelize and crisp up let's work on
the other vegetables take one bell
pepper to remove the step three-quarter
inch pieces doesn't have to be perfect
just you want to make sure you're evenly
sized
that helps for nice even roasting add
those to my dish that already started
don't worry if you get a couple seeds in
there not the end of the world and I'll
do the same for the zucchini we're going
to cut 3/4 inch pieces I like to just
have it like this and slice and slice
one more time more olive oil 2
tablespoons salt and pepper give it a
toss here so we'll transfer it to a
rimmed baking sheet spread it out evenly
and this is going to roast pretty high
450 degrees for about 40 minutes or so
make sure you rotate the trays halfway
through so everything's cooked nice and
even so it's been about 45 minutes I can
smell the roasted vegetables nice and
tender and caramelized take the roasted
vegetable mixture slide it off the tray
make sure you get all the bits and into
the marinating Tomatoes now we're going
to take do Keaney bell pepper mixture
also looking and smelling lovely for the
best flavor so now just give this a nice
stir okay everything's nice and
combined so let this hang out while we
toast the bread and poach the eggs I
have eight slices of multigrain seeded
bread I cut them about 3/4 inch thick
here so brush these pretty generously
with olive oil nice and even so boil
this for just a couple minutes
definitely keep your eye on it so that
is done last step poaching eggs so I
have a pot of very gently simmering
water again key not boiling so start by
cracking one large egg into a tea cup or
ramekin this just helps keep the white
together with the yolk set a timer for
about three minutes and very gently
release it into the water I'm going to
do a few more here now if you always
start at say 12 o'clock and go around
the dial of a clock you'll know which
order to take them out so halfway
through the poaching just gently release
the poached eggs from the bottom of the
pan with a rubber spatula this works
great super easy
there we go I think it's really helpful
to have a slotted spoon and just very
gently slide the slotted spoon under can
get some of that water off in the pan
that's great you can test the doneness
of the yolk it should feel pretty Wiggly
this looks great for me there we go
okay now the best part let's eat to
assemble take a slice of bread nice and
crispy top it with your delicious
roasted ratatouille mixture yum yum oh
this looks so good
can't wait now it's slide one of our
eggs on perfect don't forget to season
this is your all-day ratatouille
poached egg delicious crunchy bread
crack our egg gorgeous love the yolk it
makes quick sauce
mmm Jevon such a hearty healthy
vegetarian main dish great for breakfast
lunch dinner any time you need
